comment_text: It seems incredibly fragile, better to just use some kind of compile-to-js language. IcedCoffeeScript, Clojurescript, Gopherscript and more all make it possible to avoid callbacks in a cleaner way, with fewer restrictions and probably better performance. Babel has experimental support for es7 async functions, if you really want to write javascript code.
author: adrusi
story_title: Syncify.js – Eliminates the need for callbacks in the browser
